instructions.1: Place bread, turkey and cheese in a large bowl, blend with a large spoon gently.
instructions.2: In another bowl, whisk eggs. Add flour to egg mixture and continue to whisk till blended. Then add mustard, melted butter, milk, salt and pepper. Whisk thoroughly.
instructions.3: Pour milk mixture over the bread, turkey and cheese; stir gently to blend (be careful not to over-stir as the bread can become overly moist and break apart).
instructions.4: Let stand for five to ten minutes for bread to absorb liquid.
instructions.5: Pour into a buttered 2-quart baking dish.
instructions.6: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 50 minutes (should be lightly golden and puffed). Test with a knife inserted into center - it should come out clean with little liquid on the knife.
instructions.7: For a lighter dish, consider using low-fat mild Cheddar cheese and low-fat milk.
